definition: having same given name and family name
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: “The Namesake” is a moving study of the human side of immigration.
sentences.chinese: “同名同姓”是從人的角度來看移民問題的，很感人。

sentences.english: A man of Mi who had the same first and last names as Zeng Shen killed a man.
sentences.chinese: 當地有一個與曾參同名同姓的人殺了一個人。

sentences.english: Therefore, people sharing the same name will not be affected.
sentences.chinese: 因此，不能同時殺害同名同姓的人。

sentences.english: Therefore, pepole sharing the same name will not be affected.
sentences.chinese: 因此，同名同姓者將不會受影響。

definition: five hundred years ago we were the same family (idiom) (said of persons with the same surname)
pinyin: wu3 bai3 nian2 qian2 shi4 yi1 jia1

definition: to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
two-character surname such as 司馬|司马 or 諸葛|诸葛
to have never met sb before (idiom); entirely unacquainted/a complete stranger/not to know sb from Adam
person from the same village, town, or province
literary name (an alternative name of a person stressing a moral principle)/courtesy name
to be in the same class/to be in the same squad/classmate
